Section.Title: What is XML?
Section.Para: XML is a markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.

Section.Title: Why use XML?
Section.Para: XML is a versatile language that can be used to store and transport data in a structured format.

References.Para: Special thanks to my editor, Jane Doe, for her invaluable feedback and support.

Index.Definition: A system for annotating a document in a way that is syntactically distinguishable from the text.
